header: Let's see how creative are the people reading this newsletter? My earlier attempts to tweet about the newsletter got 4-12 retweets. What if I asked you to just click on this link, edit the text and send out the tweet? What would you add to the end of the text?

entries.title: Perl says 'Hello I-Programmer'
entries.text: This is the first article I wrote to the I-Programmer.info web site. It probably won't be an earth shattering article for you but it is my first one on I-Programmer. It is mostly there so I'll have an in-house article to refer to on how to start using Perl when I write more complex examples.

entries.title: Lessons from running Perl Weekly for the first 6 weeks
entries.text: This is an article I wrote describing my experience with this list. It might be interesting to you if you'd like to look a bit at the details. I am also compering the experience with that of Peter Cooper who runs the Ruby Weekly which was the inspiartion to this newsletter.

entries.title: Parrot is a foundering project on top of a wonderful vision.
entries.text: Christoph Otto took off the gloves and started to describe how he wants Parrot and more importantly the Parrot development process should change. This is a link to the opening message on the parrot-dev mailing list.
